snippet: Steve Lonegan, a Tea Party conservative who is running against Newark’s mayor, Cory A. Booker, is reducing the gap between them in polls, alarming Democratic Party officials.
abstract: Supporters of Newark Mayor Cory A Booker, unnerved by missteps in his Senate campaign, are rushing to shore up what was supposed to be a seamless entry onto the national stage for political star; opponent and Tea Party member Steve Lonegan has gained significant ground following negative ad campaign and debate victory; billionaire supporter Mayor Michael R Bloomberg will spend more than $1 million to broadcast television commercials on Booker's behalf.

byline.contributor: Eli Rosenberg, Nate Schweber and Megan K. Scott contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Steve Lonegan, a Tea Party conservative who is running against Newark’s mayor, Cory A. Booker, is reducing the gap between them in polls, alarming Democratic Party officials.

headline.main: Anxious Allies Aiding Booker in Senate Bid
headline.print_headline: Anxious Allies Aiding Booker In Senate Bid
